intro.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to use R to analyze QSAR. Note that R is experimental and must be installed from the experimental update site before following this tutorial.

item.title: Step 1: Open the R Console
item.description: If you have R installed, then installing the Bioclipse-R Intergration feature let you access R directly from Bioclipse via the R-console. Reveal the R-console from the menu Window > Show View > Other and select R Console .

item.title: Step 2: Load the dataset into R
item.description:
Loading the dataset into R can be achieved by entering, in the R Console:
dataset <- read.delim(file="myQsarProject/dataset.csv", sep=",", header=TRUE, row.names=1, na.strings="NaN")

item.title: Step 3: Use R to analyze dataset
item.description:
Here is a simple example to demonstrate how the read file can be analyzed in R:
dataset <- as.matrix(dataset)
mod <- lm(dataset[,1] ~ dataset[,2:ncol(dataset)], na.action=na.omit)
plot(mod)
